author: Natalia Drozdiak
title: EU Opens Investigation of Linde-Praxair Merger
text:
BRUSSELS—European Union antitrust authorities on Friday opened an in-depth investigation into plans by industrial-gas giants Praxair Inc. and Germany’s Linde AG to join forces to create the market’s biggest operator, over concerns the deal could harm competition for gases, such as oxygen and helium.
The deal, announced in December 2016, would create the world’s largest industrial-gas maker, with a combined market value of around $85 billion. The sector is a critical pillar of the modern economy, with gas mixtures, such as...
